provider.name: Dr. Oncoso
provider.verification_note: NPI 5467892394 fails Luhn checksum. Field on form labeled 'DEA, NPI or TIN' — value may be a TIN or DEA number. Provider search for 'Oncoso' in Illinois returned 0 results in NPI Registry.

service.duration: Up to 6 months based on clinical response
service.setting: Infusion center initially, then home with home health

clinical_extraction.primary_diagnosis: Philadelphia chromosome-negative B-cell precursor acute lymphoblastic leukemia (B-ALL)
clinical_extraction.current_status: Clinical remission (< 5% blast cells) but MRD-positive (0.1% leukemic cells via flow cytometry)
findings: Initial bone marrow biopsy (3/29/24): 85% lymphoblasts, confirming B-ALL diagnosis
Repeat bone marrow biopsy (10/4/24): < 5% blast cells, clinical remission achieved
Flow cytometry (10/4/24): MRD+ at 0.1% leukemic cells detected

prior_treatments.agents: Vincristine (weekly), Dexamethasone (daily x28), L-asparaginase (alternate days), Daunorubicin (single dose wk 1)
Methotrexate (high-dose weekly), Mercaptopurine (daily PO), Vincristine (biweekly), Cyclophosphamide (wk 3), Doxorubicin (final wk)
Methotrexate (weekly), Mercaptopurine (daily PO), Vincristine (q4wk), Intrathecal Methotrexate (q2-3mo for CNS prophylaxis)
prior_treatments.outcome: Ongoing — MRD+ detected at post-consolidation assessment

npi_registry.detail: NPI 5467892394 fails Luhn checksum validation. Search for 'Oncoso' in IL returned 0 results.

icd10.detail: C91.00 and C91.01 not found in local demo database. Database scope limited — does not include oncology codes.

cms_coverage.detail: No LCD/NCD found for blinatumomab (J9039). Medical necessity check returned 'unknown'. Demo database limited to select policies.

key_citations.title: MRD-based treatment approach in childhood ALL (AIEOP-BFM ALL 2017)
key_citations.finding: Blinatumomab converted 77% of MRD-positive HR B-ALL patients to MRD-negative before transplant.
key_citations.relevance: Directly supports blinatumomab for pediatric MRD+ B-ALL

key_citations.title: MRD-driven intensification of initial therapy for childhood ALL
key_citations.finding: MRD-guided intensification with blinatumomab yielded high MRD conversion rates and improved EFS.
key_citations.relevance: Supports MRD-driven use of blinatumomab in first remission

key_citations.title: Anti-CD19 CAR T-cell therapy for pediatric and adult ALL
key_citations.finding: Reviews blinatumomab and CAR-T as standard-of-care immunotherapy options for B-ALL with persistent MRD.
key_citations.relevance: Confirms blinatumomab as established therapy for MRD+ B-ALL

criteria.name: Confirmed B-ALL diagnosis
criteria.evidence: Bone marrow biopsy 3/29/24: 85% lymphoblasts, B-ALL confirmed

criteria.name: FDA-approved indication
criteria.evidence: Blinatumomab FDA-approved for MRD+ B-ALL in first or second complete remission

criteria.name: Appropriate dosing and schedule
criteria.evidence: 28 mcg/day for 28 days — standard for pediatric patients >= 10 kg (pt is 30 kg)

criteria.name: Appropriate treatment setting
criteria.evidence: Infusion center initially (per labeling for cycle 1 days 1–9), then home health

recommendation.rationale: All 8 clinical criteria are met at 100%, and strong PubMed evidence supports blinatumomab for pediatric MRD+ B-ALL. However, the NPI provided (5467892394) fails checksum validation and is not found in the NPI Registry. Because provider identity verification is a mandatory prerequisite per rubric guidelines, the request must be pended to obtain a valid NPI before a final determination can be made.

code_validation.note: ICD-10 codes valid but not in local demo DB

coverage_policy.note: No LCD/NCD found in limited demo DB

gaps.action: Request valid NPI from provider office
